title: What the papers say : Sunday front pages
body_text:
By PA Reporter
Sunday's front pages focus on the fallout of RTÃ‰ director general ending negotiations with Ryan Tubridy around his contract.
The Business Post report that RTÃ‰ could be facing legal challenges over reforms by new director general Kevin Bakhurst.
Our front page today. Pick up a copy in stores or subscribe at https://t.co/LyVcHklEWC for these stories plus:

The Sunday Independent lead with comments from Ryan Tubridy who said Bakhurst wanted any excuse to back out of the deal.
Sunday Independent front page. Inside: extensive coverage of the RTÃ‰/Tubridy parting of ways - and a whole lot more pic.twitter.com/uWkGAYNSkr
â€” Alan English (@AlanEnglish9) August 19, 2023
The Irish Mail on Sunday report that RTÃ‰ will not be chasing Ryan Tubridy for the â‚¬150,000 payment.

And lots more â€¦ pic.twitter.com/Mptoho8Kwvâ€” Irish Mail on Sunday (@IrishMailSunday) August 19, 2023
In the UK, excitement about Englandâ€™s chances of winning the Womenâ€™s World Cup final fills Sundayâ€™s front pages.
Britain's Kingâ€™s message, urging the Lionesses to â€œroar to victoryâ€ is the focus of The Mail on Sunday.
MAIL: Now roar to victory Lionesses - by order of the King! #TomorrowsPapersToday pic.twitter.com/vMejoR4eBl

The Sunday Mirror says the nation will roar on the team to play the game of their lives with the headline â€œLioness we canâ€.

England captain Millie Brightâ€™s quote that the Lionesses need to play the â€œgame of our livesâ€ also makes the splash of the Sunday People.
SUNDAY PEOPLE: Game Of Our Lives #TomorrowsPapersToday pic.twitter.com/1nqA0s9QQw

While the Daily Star Sunday predicts 30 million pints will be drunk by football fans watching the match and some will be too hungover to work on Monday.

The Observer leads with a call for Countess of Chester Hospital bosses to be investigated for possible corporate manslaughter from Dr Dewi Evans, the prosecutionâ€™s lead medical expert in the Lucy Letby murder trial.
OBSERVER: Now investigate hospital bosses, Letby trial expert urges police #TomorrowsPapersToday pic.twitter.com/9xwtHKi4ri
â€” Neil Henderson (@hendopolis) August 19, 2023
The Sunday Telegraph reports that doctors have called for hospital administrators to be held accountable to a regulator similar to the General Medical Council after chances were missed to prevent Letby from killing babies in her care.
ğŸ“° The front page of tomorrow's Sunday Telegraph:

And the Independent reports that the families of Letbyâ€™s victims have called for a full public inquiry into her crimes rather than the independent probe announced by the Government.
